info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 8:27PM CDT until June 8 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
North Canadian River near Woodward affecting Woodward County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...North Canadian River near Woodward.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Near bankfull conditions extend along the river from the northwestern through the central and southeastern sections of Woodward County. Cattle and other property should be moved to locations higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded for hours by high water in side channels.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 8.0 feet early Sunday morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON
